data.title: Don't bother
data.text: My burger was burnt beyond recognition, and since I got my food to go I was left scrounging. I've been to many other locations that were top notch so I was very unhappy with this location

data.title: Nice small restaurant
data.text: Nice small restaurant.  One of my favorite burger place.  Every time I visit there one old gentleman, probably the owner hands me some coupon. So visit again. Really good place for cheap and good food.

data.title: Great location and good food
data.text:
Recently some members of our family--3 adults and 3 small children---ate at Smashburger.  This restaurant is located in a very busy location with places such as Trader Joe's and Chipotle.  Chipotle was packed so we decided to try Smashburger which also had a waiting line.  It was lunch time and parking was hard to find.
Food was very good and seemed very fresh---but probably not very healthy; although there may have been healthier choices on the menu that I didn't notice since things were so busy.  The best part was that 2 of the children ate their burgers.  The third is a picky eater and wouldn't eat his hot dog but we can't hold that against Smashburger!  The veggie burger was delicious and the fries  were excellent.
I would return to try more of the offerings.

data.title: Pricey, big servings, lots of options, delicious fries and shakes
data.text:
Smashburger is only the latest in a long string of hamburger chains to settle in the booming Silicon Valley.  

It's in the same shopping center as Chipotle, Starbucks, Pasta Promodoro, Trader Joes, and  PF Changs.  Within a half mile are the new guys on the block: Five Guys hamburgers, Habit Hamburgers, and In and Out hamburgers.  

Hundreds of parking spots, but hundreds of cars parked, and dozens circling like vultures, looking for openings  

The wife and I walk 11 minutes from our house to the shopping center, me in shorts with my smoky white, thin cross strap Birki sandals . 

Outdoor seating packed under sun umbrellas, with full size windows floor to ceiling.  

I go in, with the wife, and a birthday coupon for a free milk shake.  Bright colored solid painted walls, with regular and high bar tables.  Place is very clean, not only the tables, but the seats and floors.  Didn't use the bathrooms -I never use restaurant bathrooms for lunch, but prefer my workplace or home bathroom.

Menu on the overheads above the cashier. 

The wife orders the $7 truffle mushroom burger, while I order my $7 make my own hamburger, with a beef patty, lettuce, tomato, raw onions, pickles with ketchup on an egg bun.  

Previously I had tried the regular smashburger, but didn't care for the mustard based smashburger sauce.  Also rosemary flavored fries were not my favorite.  

We ordered one fries, and one strawberry milk shake.

The shake comes first, and is absolutely to die for.  I would have ordered a second, but the wife and I would have required a second set of larger clothes, for a bulging waist line! 

The fries and burgers come within a few minutes of ordering.  The fries are cold, and we get a free second order of fries.  Still too salty, but tasty as narrow thin fries.

The hamburgers are flattened out from smashing, and taste fine.  Lean burger, with lots of flavor and juicy, not dried out.  Large serving, leaves me smashed over -time for my afternoon nap! 

We get out of there for $17, with the lunch so filling that we didn't need dinner, except for vegetables.

Smashburger is good, but I still prefer In and Out hamburger first, and charcoal grilled Habit Hamburger second.  Smashburger would be ahead of Five Guys, by way of superior fries.

data.title: Good burgers, fresh ingredients at a reasonable price.
data.text: Nice casual place for grabbing a burger or grilled chicken sandwich.   Variety of fries that are tasty and the ingredients are always fresh.   They have a few fun  spins on their sandwiches such as truffle mushroom swiss, spinach and goat cheese, and spicy jalapeno baja.  Get what you're craving and you won't go wrong.

data.title: Great Burger Joint with a variety of other options and nice employees!
data.text:
Smashburger =’s yumminess!

We don’t have a Smashburger where we live – if we did I would visit it often.  This location is great!  

The place has a very cool ambiance to it – bright red and fun/flirty.  The colors actually tease your taste buds (I think the red subconsciously reminds me of ketchup).  The employee that took our order was super nice.

They have a great menu (see pic) with burgers, chicken sammiches and “make your own” burger/sammich options with a great variety of sides & salads.  I got the Buffalo Burger and my son got the Truffle Burger.  I got fried pickles and he got fries.  

We both agreed that the food was super tasty and we would totally go again.  The fried pickles were hands down the BEST fried pickles I’ve ever had.  My son did say that his “large” burger could have been larger but that’s coming from a growing teenager.  The total was $23.00 for both meals including 2 drinks.  Not bad at all for such large portions on the sides.

The thing I really loved that set the place apart from any other burger joint is that the meals were individually bagged and labeled rather than all shoved in one as is the norm.  (See pic).  5 stars!!!
